content:
| Key Term | Definition |
| --- | --- |
| Styles | A set of formatting options in Microsoft Word that can be applied consistently to text and paragraphs. |
| Accessible PDF | A PDF document that is optimized for accessibility, making it easy for people with disabilities to read and understand the content. |
| Character styles | Styles in Microsoft Word that can be applied to individual characters or groups of characters within a paragraph. |
| Paragraph styles | Styles in Microsoft Word that can be applied to entire paragraphs of text. |
| Customizing default styles | Modifying the default styles in Microsoft Word to better suit the specific needs of a document or user. |
| Creating new styles | Defining and saving new styles in Microsoft Word to be used in a document. |
| Evaluating accessibility | Checking a Word document for compliance with accessibility standards, including font size, color contrast, and alternative text for images. |
| Keyboard shortcuts | Keyboard combinations that can be used to quickly apply styles in Word without using the mouse. |
| Formatting options | Tools and features in Microsoft Word that can be used to improve the structure and organization of a document. |
| Consistency | The use of a consistent set of styles in a Word document to maintain a professional and organized appearance. |
